page.title: 01OVERVIEW OF NEEDWOOD AREA
page.content:
The area lies in what was the north east area of{Needwood Forest.} Despite earlier attempts at disafforestation the area was finally enclosed following the 1801 Act.
The results of this are obvious today in the{hedged fields}and{straight {roads.} Considerable{woodlands}remain, some planted with quick growing conifers, but most contain a mix of deciduous trees. There is{little {standing or running water.
There are{no villages,}but scattered farmhouses and cottages. Apart from those in agriculture, the majority of people{work}outside the area. Large areas of land are owned by the{Duchy {of Lancaster,}and Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II visited her estates here in the early 1980s.
